ygData.subject: Re: Bilge
ygData.msgSnippet: One hint I have... a great way to clear the zone quickly and with not too much mana useage is to run through the zone training as many goblins, rats, snakes,
ygData.messageBody:
One hint I have... a great way to clear the zone quickly and with not too
much mana useage is to run through the zone training as many goblins, rats,
snakes, etc that you can get to agro on you and leading them all to the NPC
Paladin camp... heh. This is assuming you are high enough level not to get
killed doing this... i am 35 and had no problem. Just get as many things
as you can to agro on you and lead them to the pallies and let them clear
the mess for you. Quick and easy. Just make sure that the Dwarf paladin
is there... if he has gone off chasing a rat, none of the others will attack
for some reason... but as long as he's there those 4 will make quick work of
your train.

Eachann Bronzeleaf
Cleric of Tunare, Tarew Marr

----- Original Message -----
From: Clay Armstrong <claya@...>
To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, January 28, 2000 8:58 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Bilge


> From: "Clay Armstrong" <claya@...>
>
> I've heard that his placeholder is one of the aqua goblin shamans that
> wander the zone.....when I got him there was a low level group keeping the
> goblin camp clear so me and a buddy just wandered the zone killing all
> goblin shaman (Bilge is a shaman). 45 minutes later he spawned in the
water
> near the entrance to Dagnor's and swam towards the goblin camp. We got
him
> as he came out of the water and fed him a dirt nap..........
>
> Dweezeman Dourbough
> 36th human cleric E'Ci
>
> ----- Original Message -----

> > sight. Somone told me he spawns on the island on the very top, but
> > I have never seen the dirty critter yet.
> >
